intro: Desmopsis izabelensis, commonly known as the Izabel's desmopsis, is a rare flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or semi-arid habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species.
